    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected double evaluate(Chromosome genotype, Activator substrate, int evalThreadIndex)
      Evaluate an individual genotype on one fitness objective (if more than one fitness objective is defined by this fitness function and/or it defines a behaviour for novelty search then BulkFitnessFunctionMT.evaluate(Chromosome, Activator, int, double[], Behaviour[]) must be overridden instead).
      boolean fitnessValuesStable()
      If the fitness value(s) and behaviour(s) for novelty search (if used) for this fitness function do not change between generations then subclasses should override this method to return true in order to avoid unnecessarily recalculating the fitness value(s) or behaviour(s).

    • Method Detail

      • fitnessValuesStable

        public boolean fitnessValuesStable()
        Description copied from class: BulkFitnessFunctionMT
        If the fitness value(s) and behaviour(s) for novelty search (if used) for this fitness function do not change between generations then subclasses should override this method to return true in order to avoid unnecessarily recalculating the fitness value(s) or behaviour(s). This default implementation returns false.
        Overrides:
        fitnessValuesStable in class BulkFitnessFunctionMT
        See Also:
        BulkFitnessFunctionMT.fitnessObjectivesCount()

      • evaluate

        protected double evaluate(Chromosome genotype,
              Activator substrate,
              int evalThreadIndex)
        Description copied from class: BulkFitnessFunctionMT
        Evaluate an individual genotype on one fitness objective (if more than one fitness objective is defined by this fitness function and/or it defines a behaviour for novelty search then BulkFitnessFunctionMT.evaluate(Chromosome, Activator, int, double[], Behaviour[]) must be overridden instead). This method is called from BulkFitnessFunctionMT.evaluate(List) and must be overridden in order to evaluate the genotypes. If the fitness function defines a performance value then this method should call Chromosome.setPerformanceValue(double). In a multi-objective set-up only the performance defined by the primary fitness function will be used. If a performance value isn't defined it will be set to the overall fitness value. This default implementation returns 0.
        Overrides:
        evaluate in class BulkFitnessFunctionMT
        Parameters:
        genotype - the genotype being evaluated. This is not usually required but may be useful in some cases.
        substrate - the phenotypic substrate of the genotype being evaluated.
        evalThreadIndex - The index of the evaluator thread. This is not usually required but may be useful in some cases.
        Returns:
        The fitness value, in the range [0, 1]. Note that if novelty is the only objective then the returned value is ignored.
